chapters.title: Introduction to Budgeting
chapters.summary: This chapter introduces the concept of budgeting, its importance in personal finance, and the various techniques that can be employed to manage money effectively.

chapters.title: The 50/30/20 Rule
chapters.summary: This chapter delves into the 50/30/20 rule, a popular budgeting method that allocates 50% of income to needs, 30% to wants, and 20% to savings and debt repayment.

chapters.title: Zero-Based Budgeting
chapters.summary: This chapter explores zero-based budgeting, a technique where every dollar of income is allocated to specific expenses, savings, or debt repayment, ensuring that income minus expenses equals zero.

chapters.title: Advanced Financial Management
chapters.summary: This chapter discusses advanced financial management techniques, including investment strategies, risk management, and long-term financial planning.
